website_summaries.verdict: When you have extremely cloudy or yellowed headlights, this kit is designed to restore them nicely.
pros: Includes sanding pads and polishing pads that you'll attach to your power drill
Has enough materials to work on a few vehicles, although if you have severely oxidized headlights, the sandpaper may wear out more quickly
cons: Takes a bit longer to achieve the clear lens results versus some other kits

customer_reviews.title: Works great...Follow the directions carefully and be patient!
customer_reviews.text: This kit works great. Plan to give it some time and patience and you'll end up with nice clean headlights. In the photos I've included, the passenger side light is the 'before' and the driver side light is the 'after'. They both looked the same before I started, and after I finished, were both clear as a bell. Also, use a corded drill with variable speed if you can. This allows more control over speed and helps with keeping light, even pressure. All you need for this kit is the power drill, spray bottle of water and some rags. I used painter's tape beneath the auto-painter's tape for an extra layer of protection.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results!
customer_reviews.text: Very rarely will I write a review but WOW!... This kit may be a little more work than some others but you get out what you put in!
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: If only it came with 2-3 of the finest 3000 grit discs
customer_reviews.text: Quality kit with almost enough product to do a few pairs of lights. If only it came with 2-3 of the finest 3000 grit discs. It took me a few hours to do the job with a plug in drill. Next time I'll make a wider cushion of paint protection with the masking tape. I ran it double thick, but not double wide and I did scuff my paint a bit. Next time I'll go double or triple wide with the masking tape. Also - I splattered the rubbing compound all over the shop. Don't be a slob like me. Overall an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Stucco Boxes

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good results
customer_reviews.text: First, the good part. The headlights on my Toyota were yellowed and fogged, but not terribly. I skipped the 500 grit step (not wanting to give myself more work than I already had) and started using the 800 grit discs. The result? This kit fixed the yellowing and the fogging and made them pretty clear again. The not so good part: Despite the product description above, there was no polishing compound and no polishing disc in the box. Just two clearcoat packs for use after the final sanding. I'm not unhappy with the results, but I believe the final product would have been better with that final polishing, and I wonder why it wasn't there.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. White

customer_reviews.title: So far I'm amazed with results
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions, after the first round of sandpaper when the lens was completely hazy I got nervous for a moment thinking what have I done! The packaging indicated they had a video on their site. Watched that, was reassured I was doing the right thing, Proceeded to complete the 2nd round of dry sanding and then the third round of wet sanding and was starting to see the positive results. Applied the clear coat, sat back, and was incredibly pleased with the result. About 1 hour 15 minutes from start to finish. If it lasts 6 months its so worth it! if longer, what a value!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, I followed the instructions and the pointers from other reviews. Take your time. I double layered the tape which was a great choice as I nicked thru the first layer in a couple places. I also made my tape double wide, supplemented with blue painter's tape too and it worked great. I also recommend opening the hood so you dont have to tape there and either laying some towels over the engine bay or wiping up splatter before it dries. I keep my engine bay very clean, so I had a bit of extra work cleaning up splatter afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: T. Throgmorton

customer_reviews.title: Works well when other restore kits did not
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm weak and lazy, but the "hand sand" headlight restorers did not work well for me. They improved things somewhat, but the lights were still hazy. Once I got the drill moving with this kit, this cleaned them up much better. Even better than taking Lysol internally, if you can believe that. Clean plastic and LED lights made a world of difference for my wife's CRV. Now we have a fighting chance of seeing Bambi when she wants to commit suicide on I-81.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus O'Boogie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money. Worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for me. I followed the instructions and my headlights are back to crystal clear. Total time was about 45 min in total for both lights. In steps 1, 2, and 3, I was like "There is no way this is going to work." But with the last step with the buffing compound, BAM!!! totally clear headlights. I was amazed at how well it worked.
customer_reviews.author: eastcoasthori

customer_reviews.title: my night vision is declining and this definition improvement was great.
customer_reviews.text: Works surprisingly well, especially for the money and time invested. I wanted an improvement, and figured for about $20 it would help some. Took about 20 minutes for both lights, MAJOR improvement in the definition and light color. Not a big difference in distance or spread to sides as that is in the light design, but instead of yellowish tint I have a much more white/bluish light passing through. Being older, my night vision is declining and this definition improvement was great.
customer_reviews.author: Kevincj46

customer_reviews.title: WORTH the $$!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a car person but my dad told me to get this for my husbands 2010 CRV headlights. It didn’t take long at all and not much knowledge other than some basic drill operating skills. Super easy and definitely worth the money. The headlights as you can see are WAY clearer now and saved a ton of money doing it ourselves. The drill died on me so I did the last two steps by hand and still worked great. Definitely be sure to tape up two or three layers where the paint is. The drill will hit the paint and ruin it.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Wiseman

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended headlight restoration kit!
customer_reviews.text: Did a ton of searching for the right kind of kit and found this on Amazon. The product came quickly and the price was lower than at Walmart, plus this was the heavy duty kit. The headlights on my 02 Prizm were clouded and yellow. I was not sure if this product would make them look good again. Using a drill made the work fairly simple. This product worked wonders on the lights, making them look like new. The beams of light coming from the headlights are sharp again and I can see a good distance off. I will be recommending this to all my friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: Like new now
customer_reviews.text: You will need a drill, paper towels and some water for this. They recommend a spray bottle but you can just use your fingers to fling water on the headlight. My headlights look new now!! Once you have everything set up next to the car and have read the directions, expect 30-40 minutes. If you were in a super hurry, don't care about perfection and know how to hold a drill straight maybe 20.
customer_reviews.author: Norman

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good result.
customer_reviews.text: It made a huge difference in my yellowed headlights. There's a lot of work and the person doing the steps might be tempted to shortcut them, but if you follow the steps, you'll see the difference. It's pretty scary to start scratching the crap out of your precious lenses. Even though, it's necessary to get the yellow out.
customer_reviews.author: thickwaistedman

customer_reviews.title: WOW....
customer_reviews.text: Best product out there to restore car headlights. Used to clean headlights on my Toyota Sienna 2003. Went from faded yellow to almost OEM clarity in about an hour. There are still very minor scratches on the lense even after using the 3000 grit sandpaper/polisher disk. However you have to 8-10 inches away from the headlight to see those scratches. No interference with light. I drive on highway and can clearly see the difference during night time driving. Highly recommended. $5 cheaper @Amazon compared to local Walmart. Make sure to watch 3M official video before using. It was great help.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Results are worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My car's headlights were very yellow and the lights did not show up very well when lit. I found this product on Amazon and was excited to try it out! This product requires a drill to sand the headlights and polish. It came with pretty much everything you need, except the drill of course. The results aren't perfect because the headlights aren't flat on my CR-V but it is a million times better than what they were before! I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. You need a drill rated 1,200 to 1,600 rpm, which would usually be a corded one. Make sure to tape off the surrounding area, and a couple layers deep, and wide. This make sure you don't over-sand and hit your paint. If you've got a suitable drill, get this, it's better than any other headlight restoration kit i've tried by miles.
customer_reviews.author: A. Post

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Our headlights went from opaque to clear with this kit. Really cool. Although not stated in the directions, we used water with each of the sanding steps. I was amazed with the results. It still takes some time, but my arms aren't aching like they would be if I did this manually. One note. My headlights have three little projecting knobs. The areas around these protrusions did not get as clear as the rest of the headlight, it was hard to get that area with the drill. If I would have stopped and manually did this around the knobs it would have looked almost perfect, but decided it was good enough the way it was.
customer_reviews.author: AggieCamm

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny. Headlights look like new.
customer_reviews.text: Restored my Porsche 911 headlights which had yellowed badly. I was surprised just how well they turned out, nearly look brand new. Follow the instructions exactly and obviously be really careful with your technique so you don't overheat the lens (keep the drill moving slowly and press gently). Be sure to tape off the surrounding paintwork with two layers and take it easy near the edges. Might want to put some towels or drop cloths around anything in the vicinity as droplets spinning off the pad will splatter a fine white mist all around.
customer_reviews.author: Anatole Burkin

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible results! I did the headlights on my wife's 09 Toyota Corolla that were weathered and had a fair amount of fogging to them. With the use of a corded drill (you can do it with a cordless but be prepared to recharge because you are doing about 2 hours of buffing) I was able to make her lights look like near new. Spend the time and do it right and you will be amazed by the results. My wife's reaction was simply, "wow!"
customer_reviews.author: C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: What a great solution for clear headlights. After 16 years in the Arizona sun, my headlights were solid yellow. Visibility was horrible but this kit cleared them right up. It does require a little work and allow an hour or two, the finished product is worth it. I highly recommend spending a couple of bucks more for the drill attachment, saves some elbow grease.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Just Wow, should have come with small spray clear cloat.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what plastic did Toyota put on its headlight housing on their Corolla that it get crappy after 6 years. Anyhow, bought this and tried this, wow, just wow, it works. My advice, just take your time, do maybe a bit longer, 45 to hour per headlight, use hands to corners. Compound it a bit more, use your old compound hanging around. Then when you're done with their synthetic wax, put alcohol and wipe the headlight housing and spray it 2x clear coat, the one that sticks to plastic, buy em at Home Depot or Lowes, it will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: R. R. Fabello

customer_reviews.title: Waited 4 days for a previously opened/half destroyed product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this product with excellent results in the past. The product (3m) is not to blame. The box showed up damaged, looked like it had already been opened and maybe returned? The sand paper was crinkled up and half of it wasn’t usable. Supposed to be prime 2 day... took 5 days to get. Over all extremely disappointed, and I’ll go back to buying this product local.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Lee

customer_reviews.title: Saves your yellowed or scratched headlamps without spending $600+
customer_reviews.text: Completing the detailed instructions for each headlamp on my Prius took approximately 20 minutes. I did not rush the job and used a powered drill as opposed to a rechargeable because the RPMs for the rechargeable did not meet the instructions requirements of about 1200 to 1500 RPMs for effective sanding. I will attach before and after photos proving how well this 3M restoration kit performs. I am 100% satisfied and do not have to buy the $600+ replacement headlamps from Toyota now.
customer_reviews.author: ActionMan

customer_reviews.title: Totally restored yellowed and scratched headlight. Now they look like new!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about starting this but the headlights were so bad I figured I would just replace them if it didn't work. The kit is easy to use all inclusive and he instructions are simple to follow. The first headlight took me about 45 minutes and the second took about 15. I went through a fully charged cordless drill battery while doing the first one so I switched to a corded which I highly recommend. I'll be buying another kit to do my wife's car now.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS W

customer_reviews.title: Looks new
customer_reviews.text: I thought about buying new headlights for my Land Rover. I’ve used other headlight restoration kits in the past on other cars with moderate satisfaction. Ran into a tumbleweed a few months back and left my headlight with deep scuffs. Purchased this, watched a couple videos and did it. Not hard at all for a novice to get the sanding right. It’s a little nerve racking when you sand a $300 a piece headlight to the point of destruction, but as you step down in the sanding process the headlight gets clearer and clearer. After the wipe application the headlights look brand new. This product saved me $600.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She can see the road again. Happy Husband.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as stated. Not really enough product if issue is very bad. Mine were on the heavy side of getting bad. They are both clear now. I think I could have done a super nice job if I had used 2 kits. But next time I will not let it get that bad. Car was 9yrs. Old when I did them.
customer_reviews.author: Little Drummer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, worked great on two large chips.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but this was way better than expected. I filled two chips on my SUV and one on my Corvette. Of the three I repaired, two are no invisible. Ironically the one I can still see the small line in was the smallest chip. I suspect since the chip was small, the resin had difficulty getting fully into the ship. The larger chips turned out better. This may explain the variety of success in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truely impressed! Made my headlights look brand new
customer_reviews.text: Pretty impressed with this. I have aftermarket headlights with a coating that was coming off making the lights look really bad. Used this and they really do look brand spanking new and crystal clear. Managed to do both headlights and both fog lights. Easy to use provided you can use a power drill. Easy instructions. Will buy again when i need it
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at how clear my lens became. Actually made the car look newer much less better visibility. Of course I didn't initially follow the instructions but I recommend you do. I first didn't tape around the lens because I thought I could control the drill pad. I was wrong. Also, be careful not to stop moving the pad or press too hard. I had one place that I apparently let the sand paper dig in and was very difficult to buff out. Of course the instructions caution against this.
customer_reviews.author: BF89

customer_reviews.title: ... headlight restoration kits and this is one of the best by far
customer_reviews.text: I've used other types of headlight restoration kits and this is one of the best by far. It is easy to use and comes with complete instructions. Sanding the lenses is very important in the first step. Take the extra time and be very thorough in step one. This makes the remainder of the restoration easy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: May 31st, 2018. I could of bought new lenses for well over $100, but for about $25 I didn't have the hassle of installing new lenses, which probably would of taken a few hours, versus about 1/2 an hour at 1/4 to 1/5 the cost. My 2006 Accord lenses are clear as the ones when I parked right beside a 2017 or 18 in my work parking lot. This is the 2nd time I've restored them, really happy.
customer_reviews.author: OldHockeyGuy

customer_reviews.title: This kit really works!!
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing! My headlights were completely yellow and fogged over and other products I tried did not work. I wish I had taken before photos. My headlights look brand new again! It makes a huge difference in the look of my car too. I would definitely recommend this product. My only caution is watch for drips when you do the clear coat wipes. I didn't notice a couple with the first pass over and they dried into the light. I didn't want to sand it out again but just look out for that and make sure you get it smooth.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Takes time and patience but works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this. I looked at getting new headlights for my 2007 Subaru Impreza but they were over $200 each. I decided to try this kit and it really worked. It was a little time consuming because you have to go slow with the sanding but it's worth the effort. Now I don't have to buy new headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great kit to restore your headlights
customer_reviews.text: Well worth it! Great kit with everything that you need! Took about an hour and a half to do both headlights. My car’s headlights turn yellow really quick, but this has been the easiest kit to use. If using a battery powered drill, ensure that you have extra batteries. I think there was enough to do 4 headlights, but I only needed 2.
customer_reviews.author: K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results. Like magic.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe the difference. I'm glad that I took a before picture for comparison. I have a 2009 Subaru Outback and the headlights have been very cloudy for at least a year. I have previously tried scrubbing them with different cleaners, but it didn't make much difference. As you can see from the attached pictures, this kit is amazing. The results speak for themselves. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Need another hobby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Enough materials here to do two sets of headlights, if only lightly clouded. If your headlights are REALLY BAD, you may use up all the sandpaper on that one set. The key is to wipe away the dust and wipe off your sandpaper often. Helps your sandpaper last longer and do more work. With one kit, I was able to restore one moderately clouded set of headlights and one set that was just starting to cloud.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie K.

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to use...
customer_reviews.text: Just followed the instructions and it worked pretty well for my headlights. However, my headlights weren't too bad. I will apply the protective Meguiar's G17804 coating after 24 hours and see if it keep my headlights from getting oxidized. Updated: I added the second coat after two days (because the next day it rain) see attached the new pictures.
customer_reviews.author: FCG

customer_reviews.title: The results are very good but it does require some skill and patience to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a first class product. It has a full set of various grit disks followed by a polishing compound. The results are very good but it does require some skill and patience to get it right, especially if your headlights have compound curves. Work in good light and check your work at each step to be sure that you have fully removed the deeper scratches from the previous steps or else you will have visible scratches in the clear lens when finished. Even with a few scratches left behind, the lenses will look 90%+ better.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeG

customer_reviews.title: No polish in the kit
customer_reviews.text: Just did an older Rav 4 that had been done laat year with a hand kit that was already fogged again. The lens became pretty clear but not completely. The kit that was delivered to me did not have the polish in it. I dont know if the kit has been changed or it was omitted. The package had not been opened. Without the polish the lens was not as clear as i anticipated. However i had a tube of Semichrome polishing compound and i used that on a cloth to hand polish the lens. It became very clear, the expected result, after that step.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 hours taking my time to do a good job. Was able to restore the headlights on ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the difference is between the other 3M kits, but this one includes 3 different levels of sanding, a polish/buff, wax/protectant and masking tape. You supply the drill, water spray bottle and rags. Make sure your drill battery is fully charged. Took me about 1.5 hours taking my time to do a good job. Was able to restore the headlights on my Honda Accord and a small motorcycle headlight and had enough left over that I could have done another small pair of headlights. Made the headlights look almost brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: So I used this as soon as it was delivered and all I can say is wow! I should have taken a before and after but I guess I was very skeptical even after all of the positive reviews and videos. One of my headlights looked like it was beyond taking the fade away but once I got done I stepped back and couldn’t believe my eyes. I would recommend this to anyone with mild to severely faded/fogged headlights. Follow the instructions without deviating from them and I promise you’ll love the end result.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCEPTIONALLY AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: My headlights were hazy and were too dim to see. I had been looking at actually replacing my headlights with aftermarket ones - then I heard that they were kinda cheap and made poorly. Someone recommended 'polishing' my existing lights. I heard about trying toothpaste and that was a waste of time. I bought this kit based on the good reviews and am so glad that I did. I'll attach a before/after pic. As long as you follow the directions; this worked exceptionally well and I'm really glad that I didn't waste my money on new headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Meets or exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: .If you follow the directions as indicated this is a very fine complete kit for restoring oxidized headlamps. I restored the headlamps on a 1999 Acura RL. I must say, they turned out beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Highly recommended NSXED

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fixes lights to look like new as ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, fixes lights to look like new as long as the haze is on the outside of the light. This kit only comes with enough wipes to do one set of lights. I did two trucks at the same time and probably could have done 3. If you want to do more sets of lights at other times, you will need more clear coat wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Don't think, just buy it.  This is the industry standard.
customer_reviews.text: I am in the car business, and have tried many different products. Don't waste your time. 3-M has made this a no-brainer. This kit I have been using, along with reorders, for over five years, and have repaired over two dozen cars. Everything else is either too expensive or a waste of time.. And I have not found anything else at any price that works as well, or as easily, or as reliably; over and over it polishes and makes headlights new again... Period.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: 3M Ruined Best Products - Confuses Customers with  Packaging
customer_reviews.text: The best kit 3M had included rubbing compound followed by synthetic wax protectant. Now I can can't find it and they have 14 different versions of headlight restoration kits, you never know what you are getting. Some have rubbing compound, some don't. Some have wax protectant, some don't. This kit has neither. Just a wipe on clear coat which is NOT what I wanted. 3M, why do you make this so difficult? I paid $34 for rubber gloves and a huge microfiber cloth. I did not what this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: garywi

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT include the polish and compound shown in picture!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product worked very well as you can see by the before and after pictures. The instructions were pretty straightforward. The only complain I have (the reason I also gave it 4 stars and not 5) is that my kit seems to have been missing the compound and polish along with the orange attachable foam that's shown in the pictures. I only had two clear coat wipes in the box in it's place. With that being said, the results were good, but I feel that it could have been better if it came with the polish as shown in the pictures of materials.
customer_reviews.author: Tahmid Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Product exceeded my expectations! It requires a good bit of effort, but a previously very badly yellowed and clouded headlight now looks brand new! My headlight was really badly yellowed and almost opaque before I began. It took almost all the sandpaper supplied to do this one really bad headlight. I actually read all the directions twice before starting so I knew exactly what I needed to do at each step. The kit contains everything needed except a drill, microfiber cloth and a mister. MUCH less expensive than replacing the headlight assembly. Top quality product that does exactly what it advertises it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can see sooo much better!! We used to use a different headlight ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW what a difference it has made!!! my headlights have been so dreary & hard to see at night even with the brights on. So i had my husband use this & wow! I can see sooo much better!! We used to use a different headlight restoration kit that didnt have the drill attachment & we thought it was doing ok. But this just proved that extra few dollars was so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great headlight cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This works great for yellow and cloudy headlights. I used it on my 2006 Honda Accord. Now it takes about 30 minuets of your time and is a bit messy with the dust and polishing compound, but it works great. Follow the directions and use tape to protect the non headlight portions such as bumper and painted areas from the sanding pads. Thank s one kit did both of my headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Leigh Thiessen

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. For large headlights
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. For large headlights, like on my Dodge Ram, I needed 2 sets as I ran through the 500 grit pads on one headlight. Couldn't find just replacement 500 pads, so I ordered another kit. So $40 for the two kits is still much cheaper than new headlights, but just know that if you're headlights are big, you might need one kit per light.
customer_reviews.author: Todd R. Wills

customer_reviews.title: Works better then I thought it would.
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well and I was able to do all of the lights on the car. Just watch out going to fast on the drill. I think I went too fast on the first one and burned the plastic alittle. Still looks a lot better then it did.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Vektor

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This did a great job of restoring the headlights of my ancient 1999 Saturn. Took a little less than half an hour for one side but that was with my daughter helping so I’m guessing it could have been a little faster in my own. :) Also, now that I know the process the second one should go a lot faster. WAY more than enough polishing cream and wax for both sides. Still have one headlight to go but guessing I could do 2-3 cars with the supplies they provide. Very happy with quantity and quality. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Starved Fool

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Awsome product. Just make sure to take your time, and do not be afraid to sand a few passes more than you think that you need to on the early steps.
customer_reviews.author: Meister

customer_reviews.title: You need to be comfortable using a hand drill to wet sand.
customer_reviews.text: All the material were provided. The results were good but not spectacular. The kit doesn't address plastic crazing on the inside of the lens but it did do the job as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The newer ultra clear plastic will net very good to excellent results
customer_reviews.text: Results will vary depending on the type of plastic that your headlights are made of. The newer ultra clear plastic will net very good to excellent results. Older plastics used in vehicles like pick-up trucks, SUV's will not yield good results. Just my opinion. Now off to buy new headlights, which I could have used the money on this to help pay for them.
customer_reviews.author: LESSIK

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this product. It takes some time to properly use as directed but cleared my headlights up significantly. (Did on a 2007 Dodge truck and 2012 Toyota SUV) Will definitely purchase again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast with great results
customer_reviews.text: I had never used one of these products before, so was skeptical. This product worked far better than I expected. I figured this would be a lengthy ordeal to clean up the lens on my daughters 2010 Fusion. It actually took probably 15 min total and the results were impressive. Clear as new. The kit is very complete with plenty of supplies. They even give you a towel and a glove! Great stuff, will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Glatthaar

customer_reviews.title: Not enough sanding pads
customer_reviews.text: Restored headlights on a 1999 Mercedes. I really didn’t think it would work, but it made them like new. I would’ve given 5 stars but they didn’t supply nearly enough sanding pads. I used the entire kit on one side. Maybe the fact that I was dealing with 21 years of build up is a factor, but given that they could double the pads for a few cents per kit...
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing, I've used it on seriously yellow lenses and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing, I've used it on seriously yellow lenses and they came out almost new. It does take some time to do. I went through like 6 batteries to get it all done. Well worth it. I just saw the same kit used on the show "Wheelers and Dealers" on the Velocity channel too.
customer_reviews.author: andthereyouare

customer_reviews.title: THE best product ever
customer_reviews.text: THE best product ever! Can't believe how AMAZING and brand new my 2008 car headlights looked! Had Jiffy Lube do this a year ago and they soon became clouded again. This product was 1/4 the price and was better then their service that took over 3 hours!!!!!!!!!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: MNS88

customer_reviews.title: Finish
customer_reviews.text: I could not get it to finish/polish to the point I felt it was ready for final finish coat. I went out and bought another brand with a buffer in it. That brand was cheaper and gave me the polishing disc I felt 3M should have included. So, I paid basically 2xs. Final finish when I got through? Like new.
customer_reviews.author: curt anderson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Worked as it should On 14 year old Toyota headlights. Easy to use with just a drill, plenty of supplies for 4 headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: This product worked great with minimal effort
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great with minimal effort. The only "difficult" part was holding the drill steady as it wanted to run away at times. The entire process for both head lights was about 90 minutes. Considering the local body shop wanted $200 to do both head lights, this product was a steal. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Not desired results
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions and it made my headlights even worse. It was better just to get brand new headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: headlights look great. Be careful not to apply to much pressure
customer_reviews.text: Overall product works, headlights look great. Be careful not to apply to much pressure, you might cause deep scratches. You should apply a UV resistant clear coat, before apply the wax. The clear coat will help stop the yellowing to return.
customer_reviews.author: J-ZAM

customer_reviews.title: It's absolutely amazing what this kit did for my headlights
customer_reviews.text: It's absolutely amazing what this kit did for my headlights. They were so bad I couldn't drive at night. Thirty minutes of sanding / buffing on each lens and they're clear as a bell... almost like magic. Plus there was enough left over to do my husband's truck.
customer_reviews.author: CFC

customer_reviews.title: Very good restoration kit.
customer_reviews.text: The kit works very well to restore headlights but it lacks some kind of protection after you restore the headlights. If you use this on your head lights and dont seal them with something like an anti UV clear coat layer for protection your head light will slowly fade back to what they used to be in a matter of months.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Item missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the product. Not all parts were in the 3M package. The 3000 sandpaper was missing. I went to my local Auto Zone and purchased the Mothers product and was very happy with the foam ball polish applicator. If I need a product again, I'll buy Mothers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It definitely works, but the kit really gives you only enough for lightly dulled headlights. If you have heavily "frosted" headlights, you will need to purchase additional sanding discs... but all in all, with patience and perseverance your headlights can look and perform like new, mine do now.
customer_reviews.author: ansionnain

customer_reviews.title: A bit of work but the results are worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great kit. It is full of quality components. It did a great job on my old headlights. The price is higher than other brands kits but this does the job. It doesn't rely on magic paste to clean up your lights. It uses multiple grit sanding and polishing to get the job done. It isn't really fast but it is really effective. I spent about 60 minutes per headlight.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for severely damaged headlight assemblies.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent kit for extremely damaged headlight assemblies. My only complaint is that I personally think that it should include a 5000 grit trizac disc to use after the 3000 grit disc. And more masking tape. I got better results by using the 5000 grit disc after the 3000 grit disc. I was able to restore 5 very bad headlights with this one kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a 10yo vehicle and the headlights were bad. My husband used this and they now look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. My headlights were extremely yellow and "cloudy" looking that it made driving difficult at night. They made my relatively new car look old and filthy. After completing the first headlight, the difference was incredible. Absolutely clear and look brand new!!!!! The process takes about 20 mins for each headlight using a drill and the kit includes plenty enough to do both headlights. Depending on how bad the headlights are, the kit may include enough supplies to complete two vehicles. I researched other kits before deciding on the 3M brand, and so glad that I did. Absolutely 100% satisfied with my purchase and my headlights look wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Working-Through-The-Grits Restoration System
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions step by step and I appreciate the results. It uses the same ‘sanding through the grits’ method I use when working on guitars and creating a smooth surface. Someone might do well to look that system up to understand how this fixes the problem with yellowed/oxidized headlights in case they’re curious. The kit also has a recommendation for how to keep your headlights maintained and I imagine that’s important to follow as well.
customer_reviews.author: G. N. AKINS

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Took the yellow haze off my 2005 Honda Accord headlights. Like new! Took some time to get used to but works great!
customer_reviews.author: Stanley J. Poreda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, saves buying a new set of headlights
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for the first time after trying others that just contain a compund and buffing wheel which yielded minimal and temporary results. The sandpaper and combined compound and protectant offer an excellent professional finish when all is said and done. There was only enough sandpaper for one pair of headlights but a good bit of compound left. Just keep that in mind in case you're planning to do multiple vehicles with this kit. Now my lenses look new and I have much brighter headlights during night driving. Very pleased overall with this 3M product
customer_reviews.author: Iain Fraser

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is Amazing!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great if I have too I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J Huber

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Dang Impressed, Enough Said
customer_reviews.text: This kit worked so well on our 15 year old car and there is a ton of product included. I did the headlights on our Lancer, the Lancer side blinker lights, and a headlight on our Honda. And there is still enough left to work a whole other car. Pretty impressive for something that didn't cost an arm and a leg. I'm definitely recommending this to anybody and everybody I know.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Before and After
customer_reviews.text: 2005 Subaru legacy gt 151,000 miles, orginal headlights before and after. Pricey kit but did an ok job.
customer_reviews.author: charles bick

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product
customer_reviews.text: I have tried different products for my 04 truck that is parked outdoors, but all came up short. This 3M product produced headlights that looked brand new. I used it on my wife's car that had some deep scratches and hade the same result. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hyde L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy of 2017
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. My BMW’s headlight lenses were foggy on the surface and this multi step process made them like new. Saved me time and lots of $$$$ by not having to replace the lenses or headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hamman

customer_reviews.title: Followed the instructions exactly and this restoration kit brought my ...
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions exactly and this restoration kit brought my 10 year old lenses back to looking new. I am giving 4 stars because the kit didn't include the sanding tools to reach tight corners or conclaves pieces of the lense.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: It couldn't have been simpler and now the headlights of two of my vehicles look amazing. Just get it
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I waited a long time to try this because I was afraid I would mess something up. It couldn't have been simpler and now the headlights of two of my vehicles look amazing. Just get it. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: I have used other brands and there is just nothing like the 3M kit
customer_reviews.text: It makes a mess but it is so worth it to finally be able to see again. I have used other brands and there is just nothing like the 3M kit, it is fast, easy, affordable and it does what you want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Crane

customer_reviews.title: Works very good.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Just follow the instructions and your headlight will be restored to almost perfect condition. It only takes approx. 30 minutes including the prep time. Like cleaning the headlight and taping around the head light and cleanup. I wish i would have taken pics of the before and after.
customer_reviews.author: joedoe

customer_reviews.title: Works,amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews. I spent about four hours, used all the sanding pads,and couldnt believe my eyes. Turned out perfect, like new,after the final coat dried.Worth every penny. I have a Dodge pick up and the lens are big.
customer_reviews.author: buffett

customer_reviews.title: This one works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used other kits and waxes and they don't work or don't last that long and this one works headlight it was used on was so bad you could not even see the light bulb inside and now they look like factory new
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Crews

customer_reviews.title: who has used it on two of her vehicles with good results. It does require elbow grease
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter, who has used it on two of her vehicles with good results. It does require elbow grease, but helps increase brightness of headlights driving at night.
customer_reviews.author: Peninsula Woman

customer_reviews.title: Wow! A product that works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: My mechanic recommended this kit as an alternative to buying new headlights. Having tried and failed to restore my van's headlights with some hand-polishing kit in the past, I was doubtful but ordered the 3M kit. What a nice surprise! The kit's directions are thorough, the procedure is easy, and the results were terrific. The headlights look like new.
customer_reviews.author: Stue Potts

customer_reviews.text: Works great way better than most kits kinda wish the jumps in sandpaper were smaller but other than that amazing product
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kadlec

customer_reviews.title: ... on a 2005 grand prix and it did an awesome job but it does take some work to get ...
customer_reviews.text: mu husband used this to restore the headlamps on a 2005 grand prix and it did an awesome job but it does take some work to get it looking perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: This does an amazing job
customer_reviews.text: This does an amazing job if you follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas F. Beauchamp

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: this help a lot when I tried to restore my headlights
customer_reviews.author: Wrecks

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended. Good for 2 vehicles.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty hard to mess up, if you follow the instructions and don't rush. Didn't have a drill with the recommended power, just a 750 watt cordless drill. Maybe it just took a few extra minutes, but still worked great. Have enough leftover product to do a 2nd vehicle after doing mine. Would recommend this to anyone wanting to restore their headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical since I have tried other brands but this product did the trick. My headlights which previously were very hazy and yellowed look brand new. The drill attachment was convenient and I was able to get both headlights done in around 40-45 minutes. This kit comes with a good amount of sanding pads and the instructions were easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, worked real good if you follow the directions. Make sure you read and understand the directions before you start so the process will go smoothly, you just can't assume you know how to use this kit, you must read the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: lilpup

customer_reviews.title: Headlights: From cloudy to clear
customer_reviews.text: Love this 3m product. With a variable speed drill, each headlight takes ~30-45 minutes to do a great job. I typically can get 6 headlights completed per kit. I'm surprised how dated a car looks with cloudy headlights and how quickly you can make a difference with this kit. Nighttime driving safety significantly improved through increased projection of light.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I tried this first
customer_reviews.text: I was about to buy new headlamps. I am glad I tried this first, save me about $200 dollars. Now that it is done, I can see where I missed a few spots, probably about 5% of the total area. It shouldn't be too much trouble to go back and sand those areas. Next time I will be more disciplined in my sanding pattern. Well worth the time and effort. It was satisfying to see the results.
customer_reviews.author: David Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Best in class!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is surely the top product of its category. I had previously used Mothers' headlight restoration kit, and had good results with that, but this 3M kit is even better. I think what made the difference was the quality of the rubbing compound used in the final step, plus this 3M kit includes a protectant polish that you apply at the end, which I don't think the other includes.
customer_reviews.author: Kam G.

product_meta.title: 3M 39165 Headlight Restoration Kit (Heavy Duty – Drill Activated)
product_meta.description: A five step process that restores the clarity of yellowed, hazy, or dull headlight lenses. Kit contains sanding discs, polishing pad with compound and protectant. Drill-Activated Sanding (Drill Not Included)
feature_bullets: For use on headlights, taillights, fog, and directional lights
Kit contains sanding discs and polishing pad with compound
Saves $100s versus purchasing a new headlight
Improves the appearance of a car - with "like new" headlights

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars619 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
